subject: Sexual Health
title: How the Pill Works
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: How the Pill Works.

hook.text: The pill tricks the body into thinking it is already pregnant, so it does not release another egg.

buildup.text: Synthetic estrogen and progestin in the pill suppress the hormonal signals that trigger ovulation.

discovery.text: The pill also thickens cervical mucus and thins the uterine lining as additional barriers to pregnancy.

twist.text: Missing even one pill can allow ovulation to restart, which is why timing and consistency matter so much.

climax.text: When taken perfectly, the pill is 99% effective. With typical use, effectiveness drops to about 91%.

punchline.text: Consistency is the pill's greatest strength and weakness.

quiz.question: How does the pill primarily prevent pregnancy?
